captions.text: [MUSIC PLAYING]
-Hi guys.
It's Brooklyn and Bailey.

And today we're going to
be doing our studio tour.
-Mm-hm.

-Which I know so many of you
guys have been waiting for.

And we finally just finished
the last little piece
of our studio.
And it is here, right behind us.
-Ta-da!
-Right now.
-Mm-hm.

-So we're going to just go
show you all of our studio
right now.
-Yes.
-Let's get started.

Really quick, this is Cute
Girl's Hairstyle Studio
on the other half of the room.
-Ta-da!

Just a brief overview
of the studio.

-OK, so the next
part of our studio,

we like to call this
like the DIY area,

because this is like where
we have all of our DIY stuff,

because we have this wonderful
white table from IKEA.

And actually, it's pretty
legit, because it has these,

like, legs that you can like
adjust based upon your height.
-Mm-hm.

-So Bailey and I
have them all the way

down because we're
so short. [LAUGHS]

The table has to be
shorter than I am.

Then we have this like
wonderful blue cart.
Can you see it over here?

-It actually holds
a lot of stuff.
-It does.
-It's helpful.

-It's got a glue stick in
here, just like random stuff
that we need all the time.
-The miscellaneous drawer.
-The miscellaneous.
Like a little, I don't know.

I feel like, you know,
back in the old days when

they cart around those
candies in the hospital,
like one of those carts.
-What?

I have no idea what
you're talking about.

-I feel like this is like
one of those like candy carts
toting candy.
-[LAUGHS]
-But it doesn't.
-Pardon me?
-Which is disappointing.

But OK, we got this little
blue cart from IKEA.
It looks pretty cute.
-Mm-hm.

-And then this all back
here, this wonderful stuff

is just miscellaneous, I guess,
decorations that we have found.
-Found slash made.

-Found slash made, slash bought
form a bunch of different

stores, and fun stuff. , Like,
we made these out of soups
cans.
-Mm-hm.

-And then we just put the
little-- what is it called?
They're like--
-Label, the chalk label.
-Chalk label thing on it.

Colored pencils and
Sharpies, and then we've
got a beautiful yarn ball.

And then I'll show you my
favorite part of the studio.
-Hm-mm-mm.
-This jar right here--
-[SMACKING SOUND]

-Is full of-- what
color is this?
Bright blue sugary gum balls.
-[HUMS]

-So that any time we're
up here, we steal one.

And it's quite handy,
so if you're hungry.

-Yeah, And then that-- see
that ram's horn skull up there?

We went and shopped
at this antique store.
-It's a skull.
It's a legit skull.

-Yeah we went to
this antique store.

And, like, my mom
and I found it.

And we thought it'd be so unique
and cool to have in the studio.

But my dad was like
no, that's creepy.

-I wonder how many diseases
I just got by touching--
-But I think-- oh, my goodness.
It's not that scary.
It's just a skull.

OK, maybe that's a little
scary, [LAUGHS] but it's OK.

-OK, I'm going to show
you another little trick.
You guys, keep on the down low.

But up here in this jar, do you
see those little blue circles--
-Mm-hm.

---that are holding the
paint brushes together?
That's actually chocolate.
So nobody really knows that.
It's kind of my secret, so.
-Well, now, I know that.
-Well, now she knows that.
So this is all my chocolate.
But I do eat that quite often.
I'm very in love with sugar.

And then several other
jars, another plant,

some more pictures over
here, and we actually

got these shelves
from Pottery Barn.

And my dad had to
hang them up for us,

because I don't
know how to do that.

And then the rest of the
stuff up here, we made these.

And we got these from
Pottery Barn, as well.
-She just hurt herself.
Show them your wound.
-[WHIMPERS] It's so bad.

--[LAUGHS] Wait,
let's get a closeup.

-It looks like a
wart on my finger.
-Ooh, wait, wait, wait.

You moved it before
the camera could focus.
Ooh, that looks like a bad one.
Yucky.

-I smashed my finger on the
light. [LAUGHS] How pitiful.

-Do you want me to kiss it
better for you, Brooklyn?
-No, I think I'm OK.
Thanks, though.
[LAUGHS]

-The next part of our studio
that we're going to show you,

and this is what
we call the B Wall,

which is pretty
self-explanatory,

considering it's a
wall full of B's.

And in case you were
wondering, which I certainly

hope you figured
this out, but the B's

stand for Brooklyn and
Bailey, because that's
what our names start with.

So we found all these B's from
a mixture of antique stores,

Hobby Lobby, or just crafts that
we made with our friend, Jenny
from ShowMeCute.

And then we have this bed
here, which is kind of
might seem strange to you all.

Why on earth do you have
a bed in your studio?

[SIGHS] [LAUGHS] But it makes
a really good background

for color, and color
is great in the video.

And also it works if you get
really tired because then you
can sleep.

And it's super fun to just
dress up for the holidays.

As you can see, the heart
is for Valentine's Day,
because that's coming up.
-Do you see this?
See the whole view.
It's like a bookshelf, you know?

You think that's where
books are, but no.
-No.
-No.
-Dun-dun-dun dun.
-This is a surprise.
Look.
-[GASPS]
-Ta-da!
-Gasp!

You see these bookshelf
rooms in movies.
-Yes.
-And now we have one.
-And now we finally have one.
So come check it out.
-Check it.
-Check it out in here.
-Dun-dun-dun dun.

-Mom wants this to
be a storage room,
but I want it as my bedroom.
-It's like so awesome.
-And I want it as a bedroom.
I do.
I want it.

This is basically where we
just put all of our cameras

supplies when
we're not using it,
-Mm-hm.

-So that the studio doesn't look
very messy, because sometimes,

when we leave the camera stuff
out, it can get pretty messy.

There's a bunch of
stuff back there.

-Why don't you tell
them what the stuff is.
- Oh, let's see.

This is our tripod
with our Canon camera.

And this one's a 7D for those
of you who know cameras.

And then this is
just our soft box.
Got it on Amazon.
-Mm-hm.
-Pretty cool stuff.

This is our taller tripod
with our other camera.

This is a 5D for those
of you who know cameras.

And our other twin soft
box over here, and then
a bunch of our mics and other--
-Mics.
---joyful things that Dad does.
And I don't know what they are.
-Yes.

So the next part of
the studio that I'm

going to be showing you is
called the Sitting Room,

because we have
this couch, which

came from a place
called World Market.

And everything on this couch
came from Pottery Barn.

So we have this blanket, and
that's [INAUDIBLE] the cat,
and then this pillow.
All of it is from Pottery Barn.

And then you guys
do remember this

is where we sat when
we showed you guys

how to make this heart last
week on our other video.

So if you guys want to
figure out how to do that,

we have a video on how to
make this lovely heart.

And then this is my
absolutely favorite part,

which I'm pretty sure we
mentioned last week, as well.
His name is Arnold.
This is our unicorn.

And my friend Trevor
actually named him

Arnold last time he
came and visited.
And it just stuck ever since.
So here is Arnold.

And then over here,
we have this hashtag,

and then we have
this Ugly Doll frame,

and then we have
this antique alarm

clock and this antique--
What's this called?
Like a nightstand?
-Table.
-This antique table.
Yes.

-Thank you guys so much for
watching our studio tour.
I hope you guys enjoyed this--
-Mm-hm.
---as much as I did.

And I also hope you guys
can convince my parents
to turn this--
-She loves it really bad.

---into my bedroom, because
I want it really bad, please,
please, please.
Turn this into my room.
I want this to be my room.
It's so cute.

-And then I can
have my own room.

-Yes, seriously, I
want my own room.
I mean, come on.

-I like sharing, but
you know, whatever.
-Yeah.

Be sure to comment below on
your favorite part of the studio
tour.
-Mm-hm.
-And we'll see y'all next week.
-(BOTH) Bye.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

-(WITH ACCENT)
Right, [INAUDIBLE].

Come eat your cookies,
or I strangle you.
-[LAUGHS] What?
Oh my gosh, what was that?

-(WITH ACCENT) Eat your cookies,
or I strangle you! [LAUGHS]

-Sounds like you're a
possessed grandma. [LAUGHS]
That was great.
